ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Charm Change
ygData.msgSnippet: My charisma is 128, and I still see lots of resists.  I hate charm kiting. At 32, I ve tried charm kiting the cyclops, and I always end up zoning either right
ygData.messageBody:
My charisma is 128, and I still see lots of resists. I hate charm kiting.
At 32, I've tried charm kiting the cyclops, and I always end up zoning
either right after or right before killing one of them...heh

It's probably my technique, but still...I stink at it.

On the other hand, I LOVE being CC in a group. :) Especially when I juggle
more than one between charm and mez... So much better than the same old
"twist & melee". :)

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Monday, May 14, 2001 4:29 PM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Charm Change


Hmm, I'm not exactly sure what my cha is, but I'm pretty sure its under 125,
and I dont have too much trouble messing something. I SUCK at charming,
find it annoying and frankly not worth the time and effort (or the healers
mana). But messing seems to work fine, can keep 2 things off pretty
reliably and still manage to sing haste. However if I'm in an area where
I'm getting high resists I usually just suck it up, sing haste, regen and
nivs and try to mitigate damage. But thats just me, maybe I need to learn
the right way to charm.

Tani, 51st Bard
Halana, 60th Shammy
Solusek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Grady [mailto:john_grady@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 14, 2001 2:24 PM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Charm Change
>
>
> I agree but that it doesn't ruin charm kiting, just makes it more
> difficult. I hate reaching over to the F8 key in between
> selo, restoration
> and re-targeting pet. Just one more finger stretching operation.
>
> I would be tempted to mez more but I fail too often at 105
> CHA and don't
> want to lose the AC to get it to > 125.
>
> Has anyone tried singing the CHA song before mez? I wondering if that
> would help get mez to stick without switching gear in between
> chanters.
>
> Tzeetch
> --- Windleaf Mistsong <windleaf@...> wrote:
>
> BTW, I tested charm kiting some frost giants (in velious) and didn't
> really have much of a problem at all. After charming a frost giant
> captain, I had him attack a frost giant savage. I restarted selos',
> retargetted my pet and waited for charm to break. Then I re-charmed my
> pet, pressed my "target nearest npc" key, and hit
> my "/pet
> attack" social while backing away to stay out of melee range.
>
> Worked like a charm.
>
>
